intro: Bredemeyera divaricata, commonly known as the variegated cycad, is a unique plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Cycadaceae family and is characterized by its stout, unbranched stem and large, pinnately compound leaves. The leaves are often variegated with white or yellow markings, adding to its ornamental appeal. It is a slow-growing plant that prefers well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern in its native range.
